title: SICK to Exhibit in Nuremberg
text:
Sensor and smart solution provider SICK AG will be presenting at the SPS IPC Drives trade fair in Nuremberg, which will be taking place on November 24–26, 2015. The company will be using the event to gather information about current trends and as an opportunity to present its products and technical projects.
SICK will also be demonstrating its wide range of solutions for many industrial applications.
On the subject of “Industrial Security Systems”, SICK will be presenting the safety technology of the future. In the future, SICK safety sensors will be even more closely connected to one another.
To read more about SICK AG in our Supplier Directory, click here 
The challenges of the future include a rapid commissioning for significantly faster system affectivity and continuous production for increased system efficiency.
In the future, SICK's smart sensors in the context of Industry 4.0 will not only be used to ensure the safety of people, but also the implementation of ever-increasing production specifications.
SICK will also be using the trade fair as an opportunity to present itself as a pioneer for vision and identification applications and will be presenting its wide range of solutions.
At the SPS IPC Drives trade fair, SICK will be demonstrating what is already possible and getting Industry 4.0 off the ground.
SICK is a manufacturer of sensors and sensor solutions for industrial applications. Founded in 1946 by Dr Erwin Sick, the company is headquartered in the German town of Waldkirch, in the Breisgau region near the city of Freiburg.
